intro: Malapoenna brawas, commonly known as the Brawas flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a vibrant display during the warmer months. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets, which are arranged oppositely along the stem. Its bark is rough and often fissured, with a reddish-brown coloration. Malapoenna brawas is typically found in savanna and woodland habitats, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
